author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police start cracking the whip again; to approach RTOs for action

The police registering cases against those riding two-wheelers without wearing helmets at Lakshmi Mills Junction in Coimbatore on Saturday.– Photo: S. Siva Saravanan

After a long time, the police on Saturday started cracking the whip against those riding two-wheelers without wearing helmets.

The police told them that Regional Transport Offices would be approached to cancel the licence of those who flouted the helmet rule.

The police said that around 700 cases were registered against rule violators. As the news about police action spread like wildfire, more vehicle users were seen wearing helmets.

“Purpose of the drive was to make more two-wheeler riders wear helmets,” said Deputy Commissioner of Police (DC) for traffic R. Sivakumar said and added that no such recommendation was given on Saturday.

He added that the police can recommend regional transport officials to initiate action against repeat violators.

“We have details of the violators. If they are found repeating the offence we will recommend cancelling the license,” he said.

“We have registered more than 1,500 cases against helmet rule violators in the last three days,” Mr. Sivakumar said. The police said that the drive would continue.
title: Licenses will be cancelled
